column4: Now king David [beloved] was old [and] stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he got no heat.

For what reason his servants said unto him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand before the king, and let her cherish him, and let her lie in your i bosom, that my lord the king may get heat.

So they sought for a fair girl throughout all the coasts of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and found Avishag [my father is a wanderer] a Shunamit [double resting place] , and brought her to the king.
And the girl [was] very fair, and cherished the king, and ministered to him: but the king knew her not.
Then Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] the son of Haggit [festive] exalted himself, saying, I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why have you i done so? and he also [was a] very goodly [man] ; and [his mother] bore him after Avshalom [my father is peace].
And he conferred with Yo’av [Yehovah is father] the son of Tz’ruyah [balsam] , and with Avyatar [my father is great] the priest: and they following Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] helped [him].

But Tzadok [righteous] the priest, and B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] , and Natan [giver] the prophet, and Shime’i [Fame] , and Re’i [friendly] , and the mighty men which [belonged] to David [beloved] , were not with Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah].

And Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] killed sheep and oxen and fat cattle by the stone of Zochelet [serpent] , which [is] by ‘Ein-Rogel (a place near Jerusalem) [Fount of the Fuller (washer and/or bleacher of clothes)] , and called all his brethren the king’s sons, and all the men of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] the king’s servants:
But Natan [giver] the prophet, and B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] , and the mighty men, and Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] his brother, he called not.

For what reason Natan [giver] spoke unto Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] the mother of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , saying, Have you i not heard that Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] the son of Haggit [festive] does reign, and David [beloved] our lord knows [it] not?
Now therefore come, let me, I pray you i , give your i counsel, that you i may save your i own life, and the life of your i son Shlomo (Solomon) [peace].

Go and get you i in unto king David [beloved] , and say unto him, Didst not you i , my lord, O king, swear unto you i female servant, saying, Assuredly Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] your i son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? why then does Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] reign?
Behold, while you i yet talk there with the king, I also will come in after you i , and confirm your i words.

And Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] went in unto the king into the chamber: and the king was very old; and Avishag [my father is a wanderer] the Shunamit [double resting place] ministered unto the king.
And Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] bowed, and did obesiance (bowing or kneeling in respect) unto the king. And the king said, What would you i?

And she said unto him, My lord, you i swore by the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] unto your i female servant, [saying] , Assuredly Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] your i son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne.
And now, behold, Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] reigns; and now, my lord the king, you i know [it] not:

And he has slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and has called all the sons of the king, and Avyatar [my father is great] the priest, and Yo’av [Yehovah is father] the captain of the host: but Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] your i servant has he not called.
And you i , my lord, O king, the eyes of all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] [are] upon you i , that you i should tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
Otherwise it shall come to pass, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] shall be counted offenders.
And, lo, while she yet talked with the king, Natan [giver] the prophet also came in.
And they told the king, saying, Behold Natan [giver] the prophet. And when he was come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
And Natan [giver] said, My lord, O king, have you i said, Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?

For he is gone down this day, and has slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and has called all the king’s sons, and the captains of the host, and Avyatar [my father is great] the priest; and, behold, they eat and drink before him, and say, Long live king Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah]!

But me, [even] me your i servant, and Tzadok [righteous] the priest, and B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] , and your i servant Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , has he not called.
Is this thing done by my lord the king, and you i have not showed [it] unto your i servant, who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?
Then king David [beloved] answered and said, Call me Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] . And she came into the king’s presence, and stood before the king.
And the king swore, and said, [As] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) lives, that has redeemed my soul out of all distress,

Even as I swore unto you i by the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , saying, Assuredly Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] your i son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so will I certainly do this day.
Then Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] bowed with [her] face to the earth, and did reverence to the king, and said, Let my lord king David [beloved] live forever.

And king David [beloved] said, Call me Tzadok [righteous] the priest, and Natan [giver] the prophet, and B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] . And they came before the king.
The king also said unto them, Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] my son to ride upon my own mule, and bring him down to Gikhon (Bursting Forth):

And let Tzadok [righteous] the priest and Natan [giver] the prophet anoint him there king over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : and blow you 2f with the trumpet, and say, God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] save king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace].

Then you 2f shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] and over Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised].

And B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] answered the king, and said, Amen: the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of my lord the king say so [too].
As the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has been with my lord the king, even so be he with Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David [beloved].

So Tzadok [righteous] the priest, and Natan [giver] the prophet, and B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] , and the K’reti [executioners] , and the P’leti [couriers] , went down, and caused Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] to ride upon king David’s [beloved] ’s mule, and brought him to Gikhon (Bursting Forth).

And Tzadok [righteous] the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacle, and anointed Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] . And they blew the trumpet; and all the people said, God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] save king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace].
And all the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them.

And Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] and all the guests that [were] with him heard [it] as they had made an end of eating. And when Yo’av [Yehovah is father] heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, For what reason [is this] noise of the city being in an uproar?

And while he yet spoke, behold, Y’honatan [Yehovah has Given] the son of Avyatar [my father is great] the priest came: and Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] said unto him, Come in; for you i [are] a valiant man, and brings good tidings.
And Y’honatan [Yehovah has Given] answered and said to Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] , Truly our lord king David [beloved] has made Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] king.

And the king has sent with him Tzadok [righteous] the priest, and Natan [giver] the prophet, and B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] , and the K’reti [executioners] , and the P’leti [couriers] , and they have caused him to ride upon the king’s mule:

And Tzadok [righteous] the priest and Natan [giver] the prophet have anointed him king in Gikhon (Bursting Forth) : and they are come up from there rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This [is] the noise that you 2f have heard.
And also Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] sits on the throne of the kingdom.

And moreover the king’s servants came to bless our lord king David [beloved] , saying, God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] make the name of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] better than you i name, and make his throne greater than you i throne. And the king bowed himself upon the bed.

And also thus said the king, Blessed (Favored by God; happy; prosperous) [be] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , which has given [one] to sit on my throne this day, my eyes even seeing [it].
And all the guests that [were] with Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] were afraid, and rose up, and went every man his way.
And Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] feared because of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , and arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

And it was told Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , saying, Behold, Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] fears king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] : for, lo, he has caught hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] swear unto me today that he will not slay his servant with the sword.

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] said, If he will show himself a worthy man, there shall not an hair of him fall to (to do entirely, do wholly) the earth: but if wickedness shall be found in him, he shall die.

So king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] sent, and they brought him down from the altar. And he came and bowed himself to king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] : and Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] said unto him, Go to your i house.
Now the days of David [beloved] drew near that he should die; and he charged Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] his son, saying,
I go the way of all the earth: be you i strong therefore, and show yourself a man;

And keep the charge of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) you i God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and his testimonies, as it is written in the law of Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , that you i may prosper in all that you i do, and to wherever you i turn yourself:

That the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) may continue his word which he spoke concerning me, saying, If you i children take heed to their way, to walk before me in twith all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail you i (said he) a man on the throne of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

Moreover you i know also what Yo’av [Yehovah is father] the son of Tz’ruyah [balsam] did to me, [and] what he did to the two captains of the hosts of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , unto Avner [my father is a lamp] the son of Ner [lamp] , and unto ‘Amasa [burden] the son of Yeter [abundance] , whom he killed, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his belt that [was] about his waist, and in his shoes that [were] on his feet.
Do therefore according to your i wisdom, and let not his grey head go down to the grave in peace.

But show kindness unto the sons of Barzillai [my iron] the Gil’adi [Hill of Testimony] , and let them be of those that eat at you i table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Avshalom [my father is peace] your i brother.

And, behold, [you i have] with you i Shime’i [Fame] the son of Gera [A Grain] , from the tribe of Binyamin [A Son of the Right Hand] of Bachurim [young men’s Villiage] , which cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Machanayim [Two Camps] : but he came down to meet me at Yarden [Descender] , and I swore to him by the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , saying, I will not put you i to death with the sword.
Now therefore hold him not guiltless: for you i [are] a wise man, and know what you i ought to do unto him; but his grey head bring you i down to the grave with blood.
So David [beloved] slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David [beloved].

And the days that David [beloved] reigned over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] [were] forty years: seven years reigned he in Hevron [Seat of Association] , and thirty and three years reigned he in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace].
Then sat Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] upon the throne of David [beloved] his father; and his kingdom was established greatly.

And Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] the son of Haggit [festive] came to Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] the mother of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] . And she said, Come you i peaceably? And he said, Peaceably.
He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto you i . And she said, Say on.

And he said, you i know that the kingdom was my, and [that] all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] set their faces on me, that I should reign: howbeit the kingdom is turned about, and is become my brother’s: for it was his from the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And now I ask one petition of you i , deny me not. And she said unto him, Say on.

And he said, Speak, I pray you i , unto Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] the king, (for he will not say you i No,) that he give me Avishag [my father is a wanderer] the Shunamit [double resting place] to wife.
And Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] said, Well; I will speak for you i unto the king.

Bat-Sheva [daughter of an oath] therefore went unto king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , to speak unto him for Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] . And the king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself unto her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a seat to be set for the king’s mother; and she sat on his right hand.
Then she said, I desire one small petition of you i; [I pray you i ] , say me not No. And the king said unto her, Ask on, my mother: for I will not say you i No.
And she said, Let Avishag [my father is a wanderer] the Shunamit [double resting place] be given to Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] your i brother to wife.

And king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] answered and said unto his mother, And why do you i ask Avishag [my father is a wanderer] the Shunamit [double resting place] for Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] ? ask for him the kingdom also; for he [is] my elder brother; even for him, and for Avyatar [my father is great] the priest, and for Yo’av [Yehovah is father] the son of Tz’ruyah [balsam].

Then king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] swore by the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , saying, God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] do so to me, and more also, if Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] have not spoken this word against his own life.

Now therefore, [as] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) lives, which has established me, and set me on the throne of David [beloved] my father, and who has made me an house, as he promised, Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] shall be put to death this day.
And king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] sent by the hand of B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] ; and he fell upon him that he died.

And unto Avyatar [my father is great] the priest said the king, Get you i to ‘Anatot [answers to prayer] , unto your i own fields; for you i [are] worthy of death: but I will not at this time put you i to death, because you i barest the ark of the Lord-Adonai [Greatest Above All Things] GOD-Yehōvih (THE FATHER) before David [beloved] my father, and because you i have been afflicted in all wherein my father was afflicted.

So Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] thrust out Avyatar [my father is great] from being priest unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ; that he might fulfill the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , which he spoke concerning the house of ‘Eli [ascension] in Shiloh [Place of Rest].

Then tidings came to Yo’av [Yehovah is father] : for Yo’av [Yehovah is father] had turned after Adoniyah [my lord is Yehovah] , though he turned not after Avshalom [my father is peace] . And Yo’av [Yehovah is father] fled unto the tabernacle of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and caught hold on the horns of the altar.

And it was told king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] that Yo’av [Yehovah is father] was fled unto the tabernacle of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ; and, behold, [he is] by the altar. Then Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] sent B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] , saying, Go, fall upon him.

And B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] came to the tabernacle of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and said unto him, Thus says the king, Come forth. And he said, No; but I will die here. And B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Yo’av [Yehovah is father] , and thus he answered me.

And the king said unto him, Do as he has said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that you i may take away the innocent blood, which Yo’av [Yehovah is father] shed, from me, and from the house of my father.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) shall return his blood upon his own head, who fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and killed them with the sword, my father David [beloved] not knowing [thereof, that is to say] , Avner [my father is a lamp] the son of Ner [lamp] , captain of the host of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and ‘Amasa [burden] the son of Yeter [abundance] , captain of the host of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised].

Their blood shall therefore return upon the head of Yo’av [Yehovah is father] , and upon the head of his seed forever: but upon David [beloved] , and upon his seed, and upon his house, and upon his throne, shall there be peace forever from the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
So B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] went up, and fell upon him, and killed him: and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.

And the king put B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] in his room over the host: and Tzadok [righteous] the priest did the king put in the room of Avyatar [my father is great].
And the king sent and called for Shime’i [Fame] , and said unto him, Build you i an house in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , and dwell there, and go not forth there any to which.
For it shall be, [that] on the day you i go out, and pass over the brook Kidron [dark] , you i shall know for certain that you i shall surely die: your i blood shall be upon your i own head.
And Shime’i [Fame] said unto the king, The saying [is] good: as my lord the king has said, so will your i servant do. And Shime’i [Fame] dwelt in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] many days.

And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shime’i [Fame] ran away unto Akhish [meaning disputed; I will blacken (or terrify) or only a man] son of Ma’akhah [oppression] king of Gat [Winepress] . And they told Shime’i [Fame] , saying, Behold, your i servants [be] in Gat [Winepress].

And Shime’i [Fame] arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gat [Winepress] to Akhish [meaning disputed; I will blacken (or terrify) or only a man] to seek his servants: and Shime’i [Fame] went, and brought his servants from Gat [Winepress].
And it was told Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] that Shime’i [Fame] had gone from Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] to Gat [Winepress] , and was come again.

And the king sent and called for Shime’i [Fame] , and said unto him, Did I not make you i to swear by the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and protested unto you i , saying, Know for a certain, on the day you i go out, and walk abroad any to which, that you i shall surely die? and you i said unto me, The word [that] I have heard [is] good.
Why then have you i not kept the oath of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and the commandment that I have charged you i with?

The king said moreover to Shime’i [Fame] , you i know all the wickedness which your i heart is privy (knowing a secret) to, that you i did to David [beloved] my father: therefore the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) shall return your i wickedness upon your i own head;

And king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] [shall be] Blessed (Favored by God; happy; prosperous) , and the throne of David [beloved] shall be established before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) forever.

So the king commanded B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] ; which went out, and fell upon him, that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace].

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] made alliance with Par’oh [Pharaoh - Great House] king of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , and took Par’oh’s [Pharaoh - Great House] daughter, and brought her into the city of David [beloved] , until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and the wall of Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] round about.
Only the people sacrificed in high places, because there was no house built unto the name of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , until those days.
And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] loved the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , walking in the statutes of David [beloved] his father: only he sacrificed and burnt incense in high places.
And the king went to Giv’on [Hill City] to sacrifice there; for that [was] the great high place: a thousand burnt offerings did Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] offer upon that altar.

In Giv’on [Hill City] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) appeared to Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] in a dream by night: and God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] said, Ask what I shall give you i.

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] said, you i have showed unto you i servant David [beloved] my father great mercy, according as he walked before you i in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with you i ; and you i have kept for him this great kindness, that you i have given him a son to sit on his throne, as [it is] this day.

And now, O Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , you i have made you i servant king instead of David [beloved] my father: and I [am but] a little child: I know not [how] to go out or come in.
And your i servant [is] in the midst of your i people which you i have chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude.
Give therefore your i servant an understanding heart to judge your i people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this your i so great a people?
And the speech pleased the Lord-Adonai [Greatest Above All Things] , that Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] had asked this thing.

And God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] said unto him, Because you i have asked this thing, and have not asked for yourself long life; neither have asked riches for yourself, nor have asked the life of your i enemies; but have asked for yourself understanding to discern judgment;

Behold, I have done according to your i words: lo, I have given you i a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like you i before you i , neither after you i shall any arise like unto you i.
And I have also given you i that which you i have not asked, both riches, and honour: so that there shall not be any among the kings like unto you i all your i days.
And if you i will walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as your i father David [beloved] did walk, then I will lengthen your i days.

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] awoke; and, behold, [it was] a dream. And he came to Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , and stood before the ark of the covenant of the Lord-Adonai [Greatest Above All Things] , and offered up burnt offerings, and offered peace offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.
Then came there two women, [that were] prostitutes, unto the king, and stood before him.
And the one woman said, O my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house.
And it came to pass the third day after that I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also: and we [were] together; [there was] no stranger with us in the house, save we two in the house.
And this woman’s child died in the night; because she overlaid it.
And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while your i female servant slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.
And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead: but when I had considered it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, which I did bear.
And the other woman said, No; but the living [is] my son, and the dead [is] your i son. And this said, No; but the dead [is] your i son, and the living [is] my son. Thus they spoke before the king.
Then said the king, The one says, This [is] my son that lives, and your i son [is] the dead: and the other says, No; but your i son [is] the dead, and my son [is] the living.
And the king said, Bring me a sword. And they brought a sword before the king.
And the king said, Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.

Then spoke the woman whose the living child [was] unto the king, for her bowels (inward parts; affections) yearned upon her son, and she said, O my lord, give her the living child, and in no way slay it. But the other said, Let it be neither my nor your i, [but] divide [it].
Then the king answered and said, Give her the living child, and assuredly not (by no means) slay it: she [is] the mother thereof.

And all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] [was] in him, to do judgment.
So king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] was king over all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And these [were] the princes which he had; ‘Azaryah [Yehovah has helped] the son of Tzadok [righteous] the priest,

Elichoref [God of winter (harvest time)] and Achiyah [brother of Yehovah] , the sons of Shisha [Yehovah contends] , scribes; Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the son of Achilud [child’s brother] , the recorder.
And B’nayahu [Yehovah has built] the son of Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] [was] over the host: and Tzadok [righteous] and Avyatar [my father is great] [were] the priests:
And ‘Azaryah [Yehovah has helped] the son of Natan [giver] [was] over the officers: and Zavud [given] the son of Natan [giver] [was] principal officer, [and] the king’s friend:
And Achishar [my brother sang] [was] over the household: and Adoniram [my lord is exalted] the son of ‘Avda [servant of Yehovah] [was] over the tribute.

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] had twelve officers over all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , which provided victuals (food for humans) for the king and his household: each man his month in a year made provision.
And these [are] their names: The son of Hur [Liberty] , in mount Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful]:
The son of Deker [son of stabbing] , in Makatz [end] , and in Sha’alvim [Place of Foxes] , and Beit-Shemesh [House of the Sun] , and Eilon-Beit-Hanan [oak of the house of grace]:
The son of Hesed [son of mercy] , in Arubot [windows] ; to him [pertained] Sokhoh [bushy] , and all the land of Hefer [A Well]:
The son of Avinadav [my father is noble] , in all the region of Dor [Generation] ; which had Tafat [ornament] the daughter of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] to wife:

Ba’ana [in the affliction] the son of Achilud [child’s brother]; [to him pertained] Ta’anakh [Sandy] and Megiddo [Place of Crowds] , and all Beit-Sh’an [House of Ease] , which [is] by Tzartan [their distress] beneath Yizre’el [God Sows] , from Beit-Sh’an [House of Ease] to Avel-M’cholah [Meadow of Dancing], [even] unto [the place that is] beyond Yokne’am [The People Lament]:

The son of Gever [the Son of man] , in Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region] ; to him [pertained] the towns of Ya’ir [He Enlightens] the son of M’nasheh [Causing to Forget] , which [are] in Gil’ad [Rocky Region] ; to him [also pertained] the region of Argov [Heap of Clods] , which [is] in Bashan [Fruitful] , threescore great cities with walls and brazen bars:
Ahinadav [Generous] the son of ‘Iddo [His witness] [had] Machanayim [Two Camps]:
Achima’atz [my brother is anger (wrath)] [was] in Naftali [My Wrestling] ; he also took Basmat [spice] the daughter of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] to wife:
Ba’anah [in affliction] the son of Hushai [hasting] [was] in Asher [Happy] and in Alot [mistresses]:
Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the son of Paruach [sprout] , in Yissakhar [There Is Recompense]:
Shime’i [Fame] the son of Elah [an oak] , in Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength]:

Gever [the Son of man] the son of Uri [my light, my fire] [was] in the country of Gil’ad [Rocky Region], [in] the country of Sichon [Warrior] king of the Emori [Highlanders] , and of ‘Og [Long-necked] king of Bashan [Fruitful] ; and [he was] the only officer which [was] in the land.
Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] and Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] [were] many, as the sand which [is] by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking, and making merry.

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] reigned over all kingdoms from the river unto the land of the P’lishtim [Immigrants] , and unto the border of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] : they brought presents, and served Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] all the days of his life.
And Shlomo’s (Solomon) [peace] provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal,
Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and an hundred sheep, beside harts, and roebucks, and fallow (to approve, commend, accept) deer, and fatted fowl.

For he had dominion over all [the region] on this side the river, from Tifsach [cross over] even to ‘Azah [The Strong] , over all the kings on this side the river: and he had peace on all sides round about him.

And Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] and Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan [Judge] even to Be’er-sheva [Well of the sevenfold Oath] , all the days of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace].
And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
And those officers provided victual for king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , and for all that came unto king Shlomo’s (Solomon) [peace] table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing.
Barley also and straw for the horses and dromedaries brought they unto the place where [the officers] were, every man according to his charge.
And God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] gave Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that [is] on the sea shore.
And Shlomo’s (Solomon) [peace] wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country, and all the wisdom of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place].

For he was wiser than all men; than Eitan [enduring] the Ezrachi [a native (as arising out of the soil)] , and Heiman [faithful] , and Kalkol [sustaining] , and Darda [pearl of knowledge] , the sons of Machol [dancing] : and his fame was in all nations round about.
And he spoke three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five.

And he spoke of trees, from the cedar tree that [is] in L’vanon [Whiteness] even unto the hyssop that springs out of the wall: he spoke also of beasts, and of fowl, and of creeping things, and of fishes.
And there came of all people to hear the wisdom of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , from all kings of the earth, which had heard of his wisdom.

And Hiram [noble] king of Tzor (Tyre) [a rock] sent his servants unto Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] ; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram [noble] was ever a lover of David [beloved].
And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] sent to Hiram [noble] , saying,

you i know how that David [beloved] my father could not build an house unto the name of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) his God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] for the wars which were about him on every side, until the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) put them under the soles of his feet.
But now the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has given me rest on every side, [so that there is] neither adversary nor evil evident.

And, behold, I purpose to build an house unto the name of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) my God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke unto David [beloved] my father, saying, Your 1s son, whom I will set upon your i throne in your i room, he shall build an house unto my name.

Now therefore command you i that they hew me cedar trees out of L’vanon [Whiteness] ; and my servants shall be with your i servants: and unto you i will I give wages for your i servants according to all that you i shall appoint: for you i know that [there is] not among us any that can skill to hew timber like unto the Tzidonim [Hunting].

And it came to pass, when Hiram [noble] heard the words of Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed (Favored by God; happy; prosperous) [be] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) this day, which has given unto David [beloved] a wise son over this great people.

And Hiram [noble] sent to Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , saying, I have considered the things which you i sent to me for: [and] I will do all your i desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.

My servants shall bring [them] down from L’vanon [Whiteness] unto the sea: and I will convey them by sea in floats unto the place that you i shall appoint me, and will cause them to be discharged there, and you i shall receive [them] : and you i shall accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.
So Hiram [noble] gave Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] cedar trees and fir trees [according to] all his desire.

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] gave Hiram [noble] twenty thousand measures of wheat [for] food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] to Hiram [noble] year by year.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) gave Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram [noble] and Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] ; and they two made a league (a covenant or compact made between persons, parties, states, etc., for the promotion or maintenance of common interests or for mutual assistance or service.) together.
And king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] raised a levy out of all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] ; and the levy was thirty thousand men.
And he sent them to L’vanon [Whiteness] , ten thousand a month by courses: a month they were in L’vanon [Whiteness], [and] two months at home: and Adoniram [my lord is exalted] [was] over the levy.
And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] had threescore and ten thousand that bore burdens, and eighty thousand hewers in the mountains;
Beside the chief of Shlomo’s (Solomon) [peace] officers which [were] over the work, three thousand and three hundred, which ruled over the people that wrought in the work.
And the king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly stones, [and] hewed stones, to lay the foundation of the house.
And Shlomo’s (Solomon) [peace] builders and Hiram [noble] ’s builders did hew [them] , and the stonesquarers: so they prepared timber and stones to build the house.

And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] were come out of the land of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , in the fourth year of Shlomo’s (Solomon) [peace] reign over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , in the month Ziv [brightness] , which [is] the second month, that he began to build the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And the house which king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] built for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , the length thereof [was] threescore cubits, and the breadth thereof twenty [cubits] , and the height thereof thirty cubits.
And the porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits [was] the length thereof, according to the breadth of the house; [and] ten cubits [was] the breadth thereof before the house.
And for the house he made windows of narrow lights.
And against the wall of the house he built chambers round about, [against] the walls of the house round about, [both] of the temple and of the oracle: and he made chambers round about:

The nethermost chamber [was] five cubits broad, and the middle [was] six cubits broad, and the third [was] seven cubits broad: for without [in the wall] of the house he made narrowed rests round about, that [the beams] should not be fastened in the walls of the house.

And the house, when it was in building, was built of stone made ready before it was brought there: so that there was neither hammer nor axe [nor] any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was in building.
The door for the middle chamber [was] in the right side of the house: and they went up with winding stairs into the middle [chamber] , and out of the middle into the third.
So he built the house, and finished it; and covered the house with beams and boards of cedar.
And [then] he built chambers against all the house, five cubits high: and they rested on the house [with] timber of cedar.
And the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) came to Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , saying,

[Concerning] this house which you i are in building, if you i will walk in my statutes, and execute my judgments, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I perform my word with you i , which I spoke unto David [beloved] you i father:
And I will dwell among the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and will not forsake my people Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
So Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] built the house, and finished it.

And he built the walls of the house within with boards of cedar, both the floor of the house, and the walls of the ceiling: [and] he covered [them] on the inside with wood, and covered the floor of the house with planks of fir.
And he built twenty cubits on the sides of the house, both the floor and the walls with boards of cedar: he even built [them] for it within, [even] for the oracle, [even] for the most holy [place].
And the house, that [is] , the temple before it, was forty cubits [long].
And the cedar of the house within [was] carved with knops and open flowers: all [was] cedar; there was no stone seen.
And the oracle he prepared in the house within, to set there the ark of the covenant of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And the oracle in the forepart [was] twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in the height thereof: and he overlaid it with pure gold; and [so] covered the altar [which was of] cedar.
So Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he made a partition by the chains of gold before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.
And the whole house he overlaid with gold, until he had finished all the house: also the whole altar that [was] by the oracle he overlaid with gold.
And within the oracle he made two k’vurim (cherubim) [of] olive tree, [each] ten cubits high.

And five cubits [was] the one wing of the cherub [keruv] , and five cubits the other wing of the cherub [keruv] : from the uttermost part of the one wing unto the uttermost part of the other [were] ten cubits.
And the other cherub [keruv] [was] ten cubits: both the k’vurim (cherubim) [were] of one measure and one size.
The height of the one cherub [keruv] [was] ten cubits, and so [was it] of the other cherub [keruv].

And he set the k’vurim (cherubim) within the inner house: and they stretched forth the wings of the k’vurim (cherubim) , so that the wing of the one touched the [one] wall, and the wing of the other cherub [keruv] touched the other wall; and their wings touched one another in the midst of the house.
And he overlaid the k’vurim (cherubim) with gold.
And he carved all the walls of the house round about with carved figures of k’vurim (cherubim) and palm trees and open flowers, within and without.
And the floor of the house he overlaid with gold, within and without.
And for the entering of the oracle he made doors [of] olive tree: the lintel (top of the door frame) [and] side posts [were] a fifth part [of the wall].

The two doors also [were of] olive tree; and he carved upon them carvings of k’vurim (cherubim) and palm trees and open flowers, and overlaid [them] with gold, and spread gold upon the k’vurim (cherubim) , and upon the palm trees.
So also made he for the door of the temple posts [of] olive tree, a fourth part [of the wall].
And the two doors [were of] fir tree: the two leaves of the one door [were] folding, and the two leaves of the other door [were] folding.
And he carved [thereon] k’vurim (cherubim) and palm trees and open flowers: and covered [them] with gold fitted upon the carved work.
And he built the inner court with three rows of hewed stone, and a row of cedar beams.
In the fourth year was the foundation of the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) laid, in the month Ziv [brightness]:

And in the eleventh year, in the month Bul [increase: produce], which [is] the eighth month, was the house finished throughout all the parts thereof, and according to all the fashion of it. So was he seven years in building it.
But Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house.

He built also the house of the forest of L’vanon [Whiteness] ; the length thereof [was] an hundred cubits, and the breadth thereof fifty cubits, and the height thereof thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon the pillars.
And [it was] covered with cedar above upon the beams, that [lay] on forty five pillars, fifteen [in] a row.
And [there were] windows [in] three rows, and light [was] against light [in] three ranks.
And all the doors and posts [were] square, with the windows: and light [was] against light [in] three ranks.

And he made a porch of pillars; the length thereof [was] fifty cubits, and the breadth thereof thirty cubits: and the porch [was] before them: and the [other] pillars and the thick beam [were] before them.
Then he made a porch for the throne where he might judge, [even] the porch of judgment: and [it was] covered with cedar from one side of the floor to the other.

And his house where he dwelt [had] another court within the porch, [which] was of the like work. Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] made also an house for Par’oh’s [Pharaoh - Great House] daughter, whom he had taken [to wife] , like unto this porch.

All these [were of] costly stones, according to the measures of hewed stones, sawed with saws, within and without, even from the foundation unto the coping (top of a wall, sloped to drain off water) , and [so] on the outside toward the great court.
And the foundation [was of] costly stones, even great stones, stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits.
And above [were] costly stones, after the measures of hewed stones, and cedars.

And the great court round about [was] with three rows of hewed stones, and a row of cedar beams, both for the inner court of the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and for the porch of the house.
And king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] sent and fetched Hiram [noble] out of Tzor [a rock].

He [was] a widow’s son of the tribe of Naftali [My Wrestling] , and his father [was] a man of Tzor [a rock] , a worker in brass: and he was filled with wisdom, and understanding, and cunning to work all works in brass. And he came to king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , and wrought all his work.
For he cast two pillars of brass, of eighteen cubits high apiece: and a line of twelve cubits did compass (go around, encircle; encompass) either of them about.
And he made two columns [of] molten brass, to set upon the tops of the pillars: the height of the one column [was] five cubits, and the height of the other column [was] five cubits:
[And] nets of checker work, and wreaths of chain work, for the columns which [were] upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one column, and seven for the other column.
And he made the pillars, and two rows round about upon the one network, to cover the columns that [were] upon the top, with pomegranates: and so did he for the other column.
And the columns that [were] upon the top of the pillars [were] of lily work in the porch, four cubits.

And the columns upon the two pillars [had pomegranates] also above, over against the belly which [was] by the network: and the pomegranates [were] two hundred in rows round about upon the other column.

And he set up the pillars in the porch of the temple: and he set up the right pillar, and called the name thereof Yakhin [He will establish] : and he set up the left pillar, and called the name thereof Bo’az [a high rate of movement].
And upon the top of the pillars [was] lily work: so was the work of the pillars finished.

And he made a molten sea, ten cubits from the one brim to the other: [it was] round all about, and his height [was] five cubits: and a line of thirty cubits did compass (go around, encircle; encompass) it round about.
And under the brim of it round about [there were] knops compassing it, ten in a cubit, compassing the sea round about: the knops [were] cast in two rows, when it was cast.

It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east: and the sea [was set] above upon them, and all their hinder parts [were] inward.
And it [was] an hand breadth thick, and the brim thereof was wrought like the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies: it contained two thousand baths.
And he made ten bases of brass; four cubits [was] the length of one base, and four cubits the breadth thereof, and three cubits the height of it.
And the work of the bases [was] on this [manner] : they had borders, and the borders [were] between the ledges:

And on the borders that [were] between the ledges [were] lions, oxen, and k’vurim (cherubim) : and upon the ledges [there was] a base above: and beneath the lions and oxen [were] certain additions made of thin work.
And every base had four brazen wheels, and plates of brass: and the four corners thereof had supports: under the Wash basin [were] supports molten, at the side of every addition.

And the mouth of it within the column and above [was] a cubit: but the mouth thereof [was] round [after] the work of the base, a cubit and an half: and also upon the mouth of it [were] gravings with their borders, Foursquare (squared; four cornered) , not round.
And under the borders [were] four wheels; and the axletrees of the wheels [were joined] to the base: and the height of a wheel [was] a cubit and half a cubit.
And the work of the wheels [was] like the work of a chariot wheel: their axletrees, and their naves, and their felloes, and their spokes, [were] all molten.
And [there were] four supports to the four corners of one base: [and] the supports [were] of the very base itself.
And in the top of the base [was there] a round compass (go around, encircle; encompass) of half a cubit high: and on the top of the base the ledges thereof and the borders thereof [were] of the same.
For on the plates of the ledges thereof, and on the borders thereof, he graved k’vurim (cherubim) , lions, and palm trees, according to the proportion of everyone, and additions round about.
After this [manner] he made the ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure, [and] one size.
Then made he ten lavers of brass: one Wash basin contained forty baths: [and] every Wash basin was four cubits: [and] upon everyone of the ten bases one Wash basin.
And he put five bases on the right side of the house, and five on the left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward over against the south.

And Hiram [noble] made the lavers, and the shovels, and the basins. So Hiram [noble] made an end of doing all the work that he made king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] for the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate):
The two pillars, and the [two] bowls of the columns that [were] on the top of the two pillars; and the two networks, to cover the two bowls of the columns which [were] upon the top of the pillars;
And four hundred pomegranates for the two networks, [even] two rows of pomegranates for one network, to cover the two bowls of the columns that [were] upon the pillars;
And the ten bases, and ten lavers on the bases;
And one sea, and twelve oxen under the sea;

And the pots, and the shovels, and the basins: and all these vessels, which Hiram [noble] made to king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] for the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate), [were of] bright brass.
In the plain of Yarden [Descender] did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Sukkot [Booths] and Tzartan [their distress].
And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] left all the vessels [unweighed] , because they were exceeding many: neither was the weight of the brass found out.

And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] made all the vessels that [pertained] unto the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : the altar of gold, and the table of gold, whereupon the showbread [was],
And the candlesticks of pure gold, five on the right [side] , and five on the left, before the oracle, with the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs [of] gold,

And the bowls, and the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the censers [of] pure gold; and the hinges [of] gold, [both] for the doors of the inner house, the most holy [place, and] for the doors of the house, [that is to say] , of the temple.

So was ended all the work that king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] made for the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) . And Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] brought in the things which David [beloved] his father had dedicated; [even] the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, did he put among the treasures of the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

Then Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] assembled the elders of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and all the heads of the tribes, the chief of the fathers of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , unto king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , that they might bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) out of the city of David [beloved] , which [is] Tziyon [parched place].
And all the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] assembled themselves unto king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] at the feast in the month Etanim [enduring] , which [is] the seventh month.
And all the elders of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] came, and the priests took up the ark.

And they brought up the ark of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and the tabernacle of the congregation, and all the holy vessels that [were] in the tabernacle, even those did the priests and the Levi’im (Levites) [Joined to] bring up.

And king Shlomo (Solomon) [peace] , and all the congregation of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , that were assembled unto him, [were] with him before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen, that could not be told nor numbered for multitude.

And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) unto his place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy [place, even] under the wings of the k’vurim (cherubim).
For the k’vurim (cherubim) spread forth [their] two wings over the place of the ark, and the k’vurim (cherubim) covered the ark and the rods (clubs) thereof above.
And they drew out the rods (clubs) , that the ends of the rods (clubs) were seen out in the holy [place] before the oracle, and they were not seen without: and there they are unto this day.

But Izevel [Ba’al exalts] his wife came to him, and said unto him, Why is your i spirit so sad, that you i eat no bread?

And he said unto her, Because I spoke unto Navot [fruits] the Yizre’eli [God Sows] , and said unto him, Give me your i vineyard for money; or else, if it please you i , I will give you i [another] vineyard for it: and he answered, I will not give you i my vineyard.

And Izevel [Ba’al exalts] his wife said unto him, Do you i now govern the kingdom of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] ? arise, [and] eat bread, and let your i heart be merry: I will give you i the vineyard of Navot [fruits] the Yizre’eli [God Sows].

So she wrote letters in Ach’av’s [father’s brother] name, and sealed [them] with his seal, and sent the letters unto the elders and to the nobles that [were] in his city, dwelling with Navot [fruits].
And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and set Navot [fruits] on high among the people:

And set two men, sons of Belial [Worthless, Good for Nothing] , before him, to bear witness against him, saying, you i did blaspheme God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] and the king. And [then] carry him out, and stone him, that he may die.

And the men of his city, [even] the elders and the nobles who were the inhabitants in his city, did as Izevel [Ba’al exalts] had sent unto them, [and] as it [was] written in the letters which she had sent unto them.
They proclaimed a fast, and set Navot [fruits] on high among the people.

And there came in two men, children of Belial [Worthless, Good for Nothing] , and sat before him: and the men of Belial [Worthless, Good for Nothing] witnessed against him, [even] against Navot [fruits] , in the presence of the people, saying, Navot [fruits] did blaspheme God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] and the king. Then they carried him forth out of the city, and stoned him with stones, that he died.
Then they sent to Izevel [Ba’al exalts] , saying, Navot [fruits] is stoned, and is dead.

And it came to pass, when Izevel [Ba’al exalts] heard that Navot [fruits] was stoned, and was dead, that Izevel [Ba’al exalts] said to Ach’av [father’s brother] , Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Navot [fruits] the Yizre’eli [God Sows] , which he refused to give you i for money: for Navot [fruits] is not alive, but dead.

And it came to pass, when Ach’av [father’s brother] heard that Navot [fruits] was dead, that Ach’av [father’s brother] rose up to go down to the vineyard of Navot [fruits] the Yizre’eli [God Sows] , to take possession of it.
And the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) came to Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] the Tishbi [captivity] , saying,

Arise, go down to meet Ach’av [father’s brother] king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , which [is] in Shomron [watch mountain] : behold, [he is] in the vineyard of Navot [fruits] , to which he is gone down to possess it.

And you i shall speak unto him, saying, Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , Have you i killed, and also taken possession? And you i shall speak unto him, saying, Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , In the place where dogs licked the blood of Navot [fruits] shall dogs lick your i blood, even yoursi.

And Ach’av [father’s brother] said to Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] , Have you i found me, O my enemy? And he answered, I have found [you i ] : because you i have sold yourself to work evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

Behold, I will bring evil upon you i , and will take away your i posterity, and will cut off from Ach’av [father’s brother] him that pisses against the wall, and him that is shut up and left in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God],

And will make your i house like the house of Yarov’am [the people will contend] the son of N’vat [aspect] , and like the house of Ba’sha [wicked] the son of Achiyah [brother of Yehovah] , for the provocation with which you i have provoked [me] to anger, and made Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to sin.
And of Izevel [Ba’al exalts] also spoke the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , saying, The dogs shall eat Izevel [Ba’al exalts] by the wall of Yizre’el [God Sows].
Him that dies of Ach’av [father’s brother] in the city the dogs shall eat; and him that dies in the field shall the fowls of the air eat.

But there was none like unto Ach’av [father’s brother] , which did sell himself to work wickedness in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , whom Izevel [Ba’al exalts] his wife stirred up.

And he did very abominably in following idols, according to all [things] as did the Emori [Highlanders] , whom the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) cast out before the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And it came to pass, when Ach’av [father’s brother] heard those words, that he rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softly.
And the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) came to Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] the Tishbi [captivity] , saying,

See you i how Ach’av [father’s brother] humbles himself before me? because he humbles himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days: [but] in his son’s days will I bring the evil upon his house.
And they continued three years without war between Aram (Syria) [exalted] and Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And it came to pass in the third year, that Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] came down to the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said unto his servants, Know you 2f that Ramot [Heights] in Gil’ad [Rocky Region] [is] ours, and we do nothing to take it not out of the hand of the king of Aram (Syria) [exalted]?

And he said unto Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] , Will you i go with me to battle to Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region] ? And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] said to the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , I [am] as you i [are] , my people as your i people, my horses as your i horses.
And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] said unto the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , Enquire, I pray you i , at the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) today.

Then the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] gathered the prophets together, about four hundred men, and said unto them, Shall I go against Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region] to battle, or shall I refrain (restrain; refrein from acting)? And they said, Go up; for the Lord-Adonai (The Father) [Greatest Above All Things] shall deliver [it] into the hand of the king.
And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] said, [Is there] not here a prophet of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) besides, that we might enquire of him?

And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said unto Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged], [There is] yet one man, Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] the son of Yimlah [whom God will fill up] , by whom we may enquire of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : but I hate him; for he does not prophesy good concerning me, but evil. And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] said, The king shouldn’t say such a thing.
Then the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] called an officer, and said, Quickly bring [here] Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] the son of Yimlah [whom God will fill up].

And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] and Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] sat each on his throne, having put on their robes, in an open place in the entrance of the gate of Shomron [watch mountain] ; and all the prophets prophesied before them.

And Tzidkiyah [Yehovah is righteous] the son of Kena’anah [trader] made him horns of iron: and he said, Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , With these shall you i push the Aram [Syrians] , until you i have consumed them.
And all the prophets prophesied so, saying, Go up to Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region] , and prosper: for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) shall deliver [it] into the king’s hand.

And the messenger that was gone to call Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] spoke unto him, saying, Behold now, the words of the prophets [declare] good unto the king with one mouth: let your i word, I pray you i , be like the word of one of them, and speak [that which is] good.
And Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] said, [As] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) lives, what the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) says unto me, that will I speak.

So he came to the king. And the king said unto him, Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] , shall we go against Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region] to battle, or shall we hold off? And he answered him, Go, and prosper: for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) shall deliver [it] into the hand of the king.

And the king said unto him, How many times shall I adjure (to command under oath or threat) you i that you i tell me nothing but [that which is] true in the name of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate)?

And he said, I saw all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] scattered upon the hills, as sheep that have not a shepherd: and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said, These have no master: let them return every man to his house in peace.
And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said unto Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] , Did I not tell you i that he would prophesy no good concerning me, but evil?

And he said, Hear you i therefore the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : I saw the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) sitting on his throne, and all the army of heaven standing by him on his right hand and on his left.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said, Who shall persuade Ach’av [father’s brother] , that he may go up and fall at Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region] ? And one said do it this way, and another said do it this way.
And there came forth a spirit, and stood before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and said, I will persuade (entice) him.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto him, How? And he said, I will go forth, and I will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets. And He said, you i shall persuade [him] , and prevail also: go forth, and do so.

Now therefore, behold, the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has put a lying spirit in the mouth of all these your i prophets, and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has spoken evil concerning you i.

But Tzidkiyah [Yehovah is righteous] the son of Kena’anah [trader] went near, and struck Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] on the cheek, and said, Which way went the Spirit of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) from me to speak to you i?
And Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] said, Behold, you i shall find out in that day, when you i shall go into an inner chamber to hide yourself.

And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said, Take Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] , and carry him back unto ‘Amon [master workman] the governor of the city, and to Yo’ash [Given by the Lord] the king’s son;
And say, Thus says the king, Put this [fellow] in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I come in peace.
And Mikhay’hu [who is like God?] said, If you i return at all in peace, the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has not spoken by me. And he said, Listen, O people, everyone of you.
So the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] and Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] went up to Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region].

And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said unto Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] , I will disguise myself, and enter into the battle; but put you i on your i robes. And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] disguised himself, and went into the battle.

But the king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] commanded his thirty and two captains that had rule over his chariots, saying, Fight neither with small nor great, save only with the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots saw Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] , that they said, Surely it [is] the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] . And they turned aside to fight against him: and Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] cried out.
And it came to pass, when the captains of the chariots perceived that it [was] not the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , that they turned back from pursuing him.

And a [certain] man drew a bow at random, and struck the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] between the joints of the harness: wherefore he said unto the driver of his chariot, Turn your i hand, and carry me out of the host; for I am wounded.
And the battle increased that day: and the king was detained (held) up in his chariot facing the Aram [Syrians] , and died at even: and the blood ran out of the wound into the midst of the chariot.
And there went a proclamation throughout the host about the going down of the sun, saying, Every man to his city, and every man to his own country.
So the king died, and was brought to Shomron [watch mountain] ; and they buried the king in Shomron [watch mountain].

And [one] washed the chariot in the pool of Shomron [watch mountain] ; and the dogs licked up his blood; and they washed his armour; according unto the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) which he spoke.

Now the rest of the acts of Ach’av [father’s brother] , and all that he did, and the ivory house which he made, and all the cities that he built, [are] they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]?
So Ach’av [father’s brother] slept with his fathers; and Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] his son reigned in his stead.

And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the son of Asa [healer; injurious?] began to reign over Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] in the fourth year of Ach’av [father’s brother] king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] [was] thirty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and five years in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] . And his mother’s name [was] ‘Azuvah [forsaken] the daughter of Shilchi [armed].

And he walked in all the ways of Asa [healer; injurious?] his father; he turned not aside from it, doing [that which was] right in the eyes of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : nevertheless the high places were not taken away; [for] the people offered and burnt incense yet in the high places.
And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] made peace with the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

Now the rest of the acts of Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] , and his might that he showed, and how he warred, [are] they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised]?
And the remnant of the sodomites, which remained in the days of his father Asa [healer; injurious?] , he took out of the land.
[There was] then no king in Edom [Red] : a deputy [was] king.
Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] made ships of Tarshish [yellow jasper] to go to Ofir [reducing to ashes] for gold: but they went not; for the ships were broken at ‘Etzyon-Gever [backbone of a man].

Then said Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] the son of Ach’av [father’s brother] unto Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] , Let my servants go with your i servants in the ships. But Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] would not.
And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David [beloved] his father: and Y’horam [Yehovah is exalted] his son reigned in his stead.

Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] the son of Ach’av [father’s brother] began to reign over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] in Shomron [watch mountain] the seventeenth year of Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , and reigned two years over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And he did evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and walked in the way of his father, and in the way of his mother, and in the way of Yarov’am [the people will contend] the son of N’vat [aspect] , who made Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to sin:

For he served Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , and worshipped him, and provoked to anger the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , according to all that his father had done.
